q: A person hears only what they understand.
h:
“A person hears only what they understand.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?
h:
“Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?” —
Rumi

q: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
h:
“Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.” —
Margaret Mead

q: Trust is the foundation of great leadership.
h:
“Trust is the foundation of great leadership.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
h:
“There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Circumstances rule men; men do not rule circumstances.
h:
“Circumstances rule men; men do not rule circumstances. ” —
Herodotus

q: Real growth comes through intense, difficult, and challenging situations.
h:
“Real growth comes through intense, difficult, and challenging situations.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
h:
“It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere. ” —
Voltaire

q: The golden opportunity you are seeking is within yourself.
h:
“The golden opportunity you are seeking is within yourself.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: It is better to light a single candle than to curse the darkness.
h:
“It is better to light a single candle than to curse the darkness.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.
h:
“Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Each problem has a positive side.
h:
“Each problem has a positive side.” —
Og Mandino

q: Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages.
h:
“Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages. ” —
George Washington

q: I discovered a long time ago that if I helped enough people get what they wanted, I would always get what I wanted and I would never have to worry.
h:
“I discovered a long time ago that if I helped enough people get what they wanted, I would always get what I wanted and I would never have to worry.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Falling down is not failure. Failure comes when you stay where you have fallen.
h:
“Falling down is not failure. Failure comes when you stay where you have fallen.” —
Socrates

q: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
h:
“Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.” —
Stephen King

q: Nothing like a health problem to turn up the contrast dial for the rest of life.
h:
“Nothing like a health problem to turn up the contrast dial for the rest of life.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: The danger of an adventure is worth a thousand days of ease and comfort.
h:
“The danger of an adventure is worth a thousand days of ease and comfort.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: The cost of leadership is self-interest.
h:
“The cost of leadership is self-interest.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Your gift is something that you can do innately better than anything else.
h:
“Your gift is something that you can do innately better than anything else.” —
Steve Harvey

q: All men are equal before fish.
h:
“All men are equal before fish.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.
h:
“Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.
h:
“You were born to win, but to be a winner you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Being in a good frame of mind helps keep one in the picture of health.
h:
“Being in a good frame of mind helps keep one in the picture of health.” —
Unknown

q: Just throw away all thoughts of imaginary things, and stand firm in that which you are.
h:
“Just throw away all thoughts of imaginary things, and stand firm in that which you are.” —
Kabir

q: A flower falls, even though we love it; and a weed grows, even though we do not love it.
h:
“A flower falls, even though we love it; and a weed grows, even though we do not love it.” —
Dogen

q: We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.
h:
“We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.” —
William Faulkner

q: Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.
h:
“Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Everybody's life is either rewarding or an example.
h:
“Everybody's life is either rewarding or an example.” —
Tony Robbins

q: There are as many opinions as there are experts.
h:
“There are as many opinions as there are experts.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: The less you open your heart to others, the more your heart suffers.
h:
“The less you open your heart to others, the more your heart suffers.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.
h:
“Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Most people fail in life not because they aim too high and miss, but because they aim too low and hit.
h:
“Most people fail in life not because they aim too high and miss, but because they aim too low and hit.” —
Les Brown

q: Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.
h:
“Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
h:
“Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.” —
Carol Burnett

q: Your purpose will be clear only when you listen to your heart.
h:
“Your purpose will be clear only when you listen to your heart.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Success is never final; failure is never fatal.
h:
“Success is never final; failure is never fatal.” —
Conrad Hilton

q: Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
h:
“Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
h:
“Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.” —
Epictetus

q: Heaven is right where you are standing.
h:
“Heaven is right where you are standing.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.
h:
“I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Sometimes you have to travel a long way to find what is near.
h:
“Sometimes you have to travel a long way to find what is near.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Correct what you can. Learn from what you can't.
h:
“Correct what you can. Learn from what you can't.” —
Toni Morrison

q: Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
h:
“Opportunities multiply as they are seized.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Passion is born deaf and dumb.
h:
“Passion is born deaf and dumb.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: People think about what they don't want and attract more of the same.
h:
“People think about what they don't want and attract more of the same.” —
Unknown

q: The nearer a man comes to a calm mind, the closer he is to strength.
h:
“The nearer a man comes to a calm mind, the closer he is to strength.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: If you're afraid - don't do it, - if you're doing it - don't be afraid!
h:
“If you're afraid - don't do it, - if you're doing it - don't be afraid! ” —
Genghis Khan

q: You are what you do, not what you say you'll do.
h:
“You are what you do, not what you say you'll do.” —
Carl Jung

q: It still holds true that man is most uniquely human when he turns obstacles into opportunities.
h:
“It still holds true that man is most uniquely human when he turns obstacles into opportunities.” —
Eric Hoffer
